intro: Couepia duckei, commonly known as the Ducke's couepia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
